title: ID these Art Deco Fonts?
content:
Working on an art deco themed exhibition board celebrating 75 years of a building and would like some help id'ing some of these fonts on this example. Any and all fonts id'd would be great. Your help is certainly appreciated.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [french\_line.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010192825/http:/typophile.com/files/french_line.jpg) | 28.69 KB |
author: lathen.kamas

comments.content:
The "Normandie" part is close to [Garage Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010192825/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/garage-gothic/),  
the other text looks Futura/Neutraface-ish, the latter even has the unique Q.

Hi Lathen,

no fonts involved, this was all done by hand.  
Check out [Mark Simonson](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010192825/http:/www.typophile.com/wiki/Mark%20Simonson)’s [Mostra Nuova](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010192825/http:/www.ms-studio.com/FontSales/mostranuova.html). It has a number of alternates, including the circular ‘G’ with horizontal bar, and the ‘Q’ with the centered vertical cauda.  
For ‘Normandie’, [Block Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010192825/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/red_rooster_collection/block_gothic_bold_condensed/?&sample_text=NORMANDIE) is the closest font I could find.  
F
Thanks Florian. That is very helpful indeed.
